snippet: Von Furstenberg and Serge Azria have created a collection of printed denim inspired by Europe's rock 'n' roll era.
abstract: Von Furstenberg and Serge Azria have created a collection of printed denim inspired by Europe's rock 'n' roll era.
lead_paragraph: "A collaboration is just like any relationship," Diane Von Furstenberg says. "You should never have to compromise who you are when you're in it." Enter DVF's collaboration with the Los Angeles jeans giant Current/Elliott. When Von Furstenberg and Current/Elliott's Serge Azria set out to create a printed denim capsule made of skinny jeans, 1980s-era pencil skirts and wrap dresses, it wasn't the obvious - "Current/Elliott knows denim," and "Diane is the queen of prints" - that made for such a seamless co-creation. Rather it was the two brands' shared love for what Azria calls "Europe's rock 'n' roll era." Out this month are cool screen-printed slacks (starting at $258) and skinny skirts ($229).

headline.main: Now Collaborating | Diane Von Furstenberg + Current/Elliot
